        Consolidated Information:
Cleeve Hill is the highest point in the Cotswolds hill range and in the county of Gloucestershire, standing at 1,083 feet (330 m) above sea level. It is located on Cleeve Common, which is a Site of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI) and is looked after by a charity called Cleeve Common Trust. The hill offers clear views to the west over Cheltenham, the racecourse, the River Severn, and into Wales, as well as to the north over Winchcombe. It is also the highest point in the drainage basin of the River Thames. Additionally, Cleeve Hill is situated in the Cotswold Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and is known for its biology and geology.
